 Molly Rytter or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stw06@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105764

title: 1st line servicedeskmedarbetare till vår kund i Sandviken
description:
Ett öppet kontorslandskap fyllt med personer som brinner för problemlösning och IT-support - låter det som din nästa arbetsplats? Som servicedeskmedarbetare kommer du stötta användare med IT-support via telefon, mail och ärendehanteringssystem. Är du den vi söker? Varmt välkommen med din ansökan.
 



  

**Plats :**
 Sandviken
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Efter sommaren
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Som servicedeskmedarbetare är du första kontakten för företagets medarbetare kopplat till IT-relaterade ärenden.
   

 Arbetet inom 1st-line support följer ofta tydliga rutiner, vilket gör denna roll perfekt för dig som vill bygga på din kunskap och erfarenhet inom IT-support.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* En spännande roll i ett kompetent team där du har stora möjligheter till vidareutveckling
  
* En dedikerad konsultchef som stöttar dig i din utveckling
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Utreda IT-relaterade ärenden via telefon, mail och fjärrsupport
  
* Logga samtal och mail i ärendehanteringssystemet
  
* Stötta användare i frågor rörande teknisk utrustning och interna IT-system
  
* Skicka vidare de mer komplexa ärendena till 2nd eller 3rd line support
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har erfarenhet av kundbemötande via mail och telefon
  
* Har ett stort tekniskt intresse och vilja att arbeta med IT
  
* Är bekväm med att prata i telefon och trivs med att ha många kontaktytor
  
* Talar och skriver obehindrat på både svenska och engelska då det krävs i dokumentation samt i kontakt med kunder
   

 För den här rollen ser vi det som meriterande om du har arbetat med liknande arbetsuppgifter sedan tidigare och/eller har vana av att arbeta med hårdvara.
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Ordningsam
  
* Hjälpsam
  
* Stabil
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Johan Andersson eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på gav01@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105760

title: Business Consultant till Linde Gas
description:
Vill du arbeta med spännande IT-projekt och bidra till en hållbar framtid? Bli en del av Linde Gas och var med och forma morgondagens teknologiska lösningar. Ansök nu och ta nästa steg i din karriär!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Linde Gas
 



  

**Plats :**
 Solna, Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Ekonomi/juridik/inköp
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Som Business Consultant inom IT hos Linde Gas kommer du att spela en central roll i utvecklingen och projektledningen av strategiska IT-projekt. Du kommer att arbeta nära ledningen för att identifiera behov och skapa skräddarsydda lösningar som förbättrar verksamhetens effektivitet och hållbarhet. Vi söker en engagerad och analytisk person som vill vara med och driva förändring i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* För den karriärsdrivne är detta en optimal möjlighet att snabbt klättra, utvecklas och få ta stort ansvar på ett globalt företag
  
* En plats i ledningsgruppen inom IT-organisationen
  
* Goda förmåner
  
* Starkt ledarskap och stöttning internt
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Projektleda IT-strategier och lösningar tillsammans med interna och externa intressenter
  
* Arbeta med förstudier, kravinsamling, presentationer och interaktioner med verksamhet och IT
  
* Ansvara för att underlätta idéfasen tillsammans med verksamheten, där du har en central roll relaterat till affärskritiska projekt
  
* Din roll kommer vara en del av IT-ledningsteamet i Region Europe North, där du rapporterar till IT-direktören
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Relevant akademisk examen inom IT, teknik eller liknande
  
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet som managementkonsult inom IT
  
* Erfarenhet av projektledning och affärsanalys
  
* Utmärkta kommunikations- och problemlösningsförmågor
  
* Kan agera konsultativt, inlyssnande och med en god förmåga kunna konkretisera möjligheter och problem för att driva diverse projekt framåt
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Stresstolerant
  
* Målmedveten
  
* Stabil
  
* Ansvarstagande
  
* Socialt självsäker
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Linde Gas**

 Linde är ett ledande globalt företag inom industrigaser och teknik. Linde lever efter sin mission att göra vår värld mer produktiv varje dag genom att tillhandahålla högkvalitativa lösningar, teknologier och tjänster som gör deras kunder mer framgångsrika och hjälper till att upprätthålla, avkarbonisera och skydda vår planet.
 


  


 Lindes industrigaser och teknologier används i otaliga applikationer, inklusive produktion av ren väte som är kritisk för energiomställningen, livräddande medicinsk syrgas och högrenade specialgaser för elektronik, bland annat. I över 50 år har Linde varit en global ledare inom väte och utnyttjar sin ingenjörskompetens, tillsammans med en betydande tillgångsbas och expertis, för att göra renare energi till verklighet världen över.
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Linde Gas**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Mikaela Hofstedt eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv3@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105984

title: Projektadministratör
description:
**Vi på Future People söker en projektadministratör** 
**till vår kund i Stockholm. Som konsult hos oss får du möjlighet till ett spännande uppdrag hos en av våra kunder samtidigt som du fortsätter att utvecklas inom ditt kompetensområde. Vi är mycket måna om att du ska trivas hos oss och på ditt uppdrag. Hos oss är du en viktig och uppskattad person, både som anställd och som kollega.**
**Ta nästa steg i karriären och utvecklas tillsammans med oss!**
 Vår kund arbetar dygnet runt, året om, tryggar dem den växande Stockholmsregionens tillgång till värme, kyla, el samt hantering av avfallstjänster. Idag är fler än 800 000 stockholmare och drygt 400 sjukhus, datahallar och andra verksamheter anslutna till fjärrvärmenätet, kopplat till deras värme- och kraftvärmeanläggningar från Högdalen i söder till Brista i norr. Med gemensam kraft driver dem Stockholm framåt med potential att bli världens första klimatpositiva huvudstad.
   

  

****Vi söker dig som:****
 En driven och engagerad konsult till vår kunds enhet som arbetar med distributionsprojekt inom fjärrvärme och fjärrkyla. Rollen som projektadministratör/projektkoordinator innebär att du kommer att vara ett viktigt stöd för våra projekt och de roller som är verksamma inom enheten. Du kommer att assistera med administrativt arbete, koordinering av projektaktiviteter samt dokumentation. Utöver detta förväntas du att aktivt bidra med förbättringsförslag och delta i genomförandet av dessa, oavsett om idéerna kommer från dig själv eller från andra i teamet. Du kommer att arbeta med affärssystemen Microsoft Dynamics och IFS, samt SharePoint och de vanliga Microsoft Office-programmen såsom Word, Excel och PowerPoint. Din roll är central för att säkerställa att våra projekt löper smidigt och effektivt med kvalitet, samtidigt som du bidrar till att förbättra kundens arbetsprocesser och verktyg.
   

  

****Krav:****
* Erfarenhet av att jobba i projekt eller projektorganisation med projektadministration och/eller projektkoordinering
* Erfarenhet av att jobba i olika IT- och affärssystem
* Färdighet i Microsoft Office-programmen (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
* Förmåga att hantera flera parallella arbetsuppgifter och hålla deadlines
* Flytande svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift


 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet från distributionsprojekt inom fjärrvärme och fjärrkyla.
   

  

 Som person är du prestigelös, engagerad och har ett starkt driv. Du är utåtriktad, förtroendeingivande och tydlig i din kommunikation. Du har en god samarbetsförmåga och tar gärna egna initiativ.
   

  

 För oss är det viktigt att varje kandidat ska få en positiv upplevelse hos oss och vi håller dig uppdaterad under hela processen. Du behöver aldrig undra vad som händer och hur just du ligger till i rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Du kommer att vara anställd av Future People och arbeta som konsult hos vår spännande kund.
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!**
**Omfattning:** 
 100%
   

  

**Start:** 
 12 Augusti minst ett år
   

  

****Sista ansökningsdagen:****
****Du söker tjänsten på futurepeople.se****
**Vi har ej möjlighet att ta emot ansökningar via e-mail med anledning av GDPR.**
 Har du frågor om rollen eller undrar hur processen ser ut framöver får du gärna kontakta oss. Vi som arbetar med processen på detta uppdrag är Therese Lönnberg, du når mig på therese.lonnberg@futurepeople.se och Liv Hedström, liv.hedstrom@futurepeople.se. Vi ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrunder och erfarenheter. Vi går igenom ansökningarna löpande och i konsultvärlden går processerna oftast snabbt. Rollen kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, vänta därför inte med att skicka in din ansökan.
   

  

**Välkommen till oss på Future People!**

title: Business Consultant
description:
**Om Midagon** 




 Midagon är en stabil, växande koncern med mångåriga kundrelationer. Vi är över 200 konsulter i Norden, varav cirka 100 befinner sig i Sverige. Vi driver uppdrag i både privat och offentlig sektor, åt stora globala aktörer såväl som nationella företag. Våra uppdrag varierar i storlek, men gemensamt är att vi hjälper våra kunder att lyckas med sina komplexa transformationer.
 



 Våra erfarna konsulter har en bakgrund inom bland annat projektledning, verksamhetsutveckling eller specialkompetens inom specifika ämnesområden. Hos oss hittar du de bästa av de bästa. Ett ypperligt kvitto är våra utmärkelser som DI Gasellföretag, Sveriges nöjdaste kunder (Radar), certifierade av ”Great place to work” samt Superföretag av Veckans affärer.
 



  





**Om jobbet** 




 Vi på Midagon vill bli fler som utvecklar och effektiviserar våra kunder till att bli framtidens ledande aktörer på marknaden. Vi växer tillsammans med våra kunder och blir framgångsrika genom att nyttja digitaliseringens möjligheter. Vi utformar styr- och ledningsmodeller, identifierar processförbättringar, skapar möjligheter till automatisering och ett effektivt nyttjande av IT. Vi är duktiga på att fånga idéer, forma strategier, göra analyser och leda genomförande. Nu söker vi dig som också drivs av detta.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 I rollen som Business Consultant hjälper du våra kunder med att stötta i förändringsarbete, från strategi hela vägen till ett förändrat beteende och nya eller förbättrade IT-stöd. Du arbetar med ledningen hos våra kunder för att ta fram tydliga beslutsunderlag och roadmaps för genomförande. Du hjälper till med att implementera nya affärsstrategier, processer och IT-system och säkerställer att förändringar genomförs smidigt och effektivt. Vi se gärna att du har förmåga att leda och hantera förändringsprocesser. Om du har arbetat som betrodd rådgivare och strategisk partner ser vi detta som en stor fördel.
 



  





**Om dig** 




 Du är en erfaren konsult som brinner för affärsutveckling och sälj, och har god vana av förändringsarbete genom digitalisering. Du är affärsmässigt lagd, tar initiativ och har en god förmåga att sätta dig in i nya situationer, förstå verksamheters behov och omsätta det till konkreta aktiviteter och lösningar. Du kan även konsten att navigera inom en verksamhets formella och informella strukturer. Du är van att arbeta med styrgrupper, intressenter samt att leda workshops på olika nivåer. Du är analytiskt lagd och kan strukturera och beskriva verksamheter i tydliga modeller. Du är en rådgivande partner som utmanar och inspirerar mot en värdedriven digital transformation, med god vana att driva förändring och implementera nya arbetssätt. Du vill vara med och utveckla våra erbjudanden, delta i säljarbetet och använda ditt nätverk för att identifiera affärsmöjligheter.
 



  





**Du har:** 



* Minst 10 år av relevant arbetslivserfarenhet, och den större delen har du arbetat som konsult
* Branscherfarenhet från Finans, Tillverkning eller Offentlig sektor
* Tagit rådgivarrollen och är trygg med att såväl utmana som stötta ledningspersoner och verksamhet
* Drivit projekt i en eller flera faser (förstudie, behov/kravanalys, implementering och utrullning, förvaltning)
* Förmåga att arbeta strategiskt, taktiskt samt operativt
* Förmåga att leda komplexa initiativ med hjälp av en rad olika metoder
* Strukturerad i kommunikation och genomförande av initiativ
* Har relevanta certifieringar inom områden som SAFe, Prosci Change Management och andra specifika områden
* Eftergymnasial utbildning
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift








**Vi erbjuder:** 



* Attraktiv lönemodell
* Ett erfaret och härligt team
* Fina utvecklingsmöjligheter
* Goda förutsättningar för flexibla arbetstider
* Möjligheter att gå relevanta utbildningar och ta attraktiva certifikat
* En fantastisk wellness- och medarbetarsatsning.



  





**Är du nyfiken?** 




 Har du ytterligare frågor eller funderingar, tveka inte att kontakta Hanna Fredriksson på Hanna.fredriksson@midagon.com, 076–00 74 551 och Martin Nilsson på martin.nilsson@midagon.com, 070-22 57 833.
 



 Välkommen till oss!

title: Senior Solutions Architect
description:
**Description**
 Automat-it is an all-in AWS Premier partner that empowers startups with DevOps and FinOps expertise and hands-on services. We guide and support hundreds of startups leveraging AWS smarter throughout their growth journey. We save our customers significant time to market and optimize their cloud performance and cost-effectiveness.
   

  

 Automat-it operates in more than seven countries across EMEA. We provide a dynamic environment where you can expand your professional expertise and make a significant impact.
   

  

 In this position as Senior Solutions Architect, you will be a crucial member of the pre-sales process, working with account managers to develop AWS solutions for our startup customers.
   

  

 📍 Work location - hybrid from Stockholm.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and implement solutions to meet business requirements and create cost-efficient, highly available, and scalable solutions for customers, including Well-Architected reviews and SoW.
* Research and analyze current solutions and initiate improvement plans.
* Collaborate with other engineers and stakeholders to ensure solutions are designed and developed according to best practices.
* Share your knowledge with our customers and the cloud community by participating in public speaking engagements such as workshops, conferences, webinars, and more.


**Requirements**
* 3+ years of hands-on experience in an AWS environment, including implementation, migration, and maintenance, designing solutions end-to-end
* 2+ years of experience in technical customer-facing roles, such as Customer Engineering, SRE, Cloud Architect, or equivalent
* 2+ years of experience in an IT environment, including hands-on in Kubernetes, CI/CD, and DevOps tools - advantage
* Proven experience in a production environment, developing software with either Python, Go, Java, or equivalents
* In-depth knowledge of AWS's main services, with an emphasis on Kubernetes and Containers
* Successfully designed DevOps and Infrastructure for high-scale production environments in AWS
* Understanding of Information Security best practices
* Certified AWS Solutions Architect - Associate.
* AWS Solutions Architect Professional or a specialty certification - an advantage
* Ability to effectively communicate technical design in verbal and written formats in front of customers
* Ability to lead an end-to-end engagement with the account management team
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both English and Swedish
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment


 Automat-it is committed to fostering a workplace that promotes equal opportunities for all. We firmly believe that cultivating a diverse workforce is crucial to our success. Our recruitment decisions are grounded in your experience and skills, recognizing the value you bring to our team.

title: Managing Director, Trilogy (Remote) - $400,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 If you think most CEOs are full of themselves (and full of other stuff)... keep reading.
   

  

 Here’s a CEO track that requires — and actually rewards — zero experience being a CEO. In this role, you’ll become an incredibly effective, customer-facing CEO in an environment with more than 100 software products.
   

  

 Who You Are
   

  

 You’ve never been a CEO before. Probably because most of the time, “CEO” is just a 3-letter code for “an exhausting hamster wheel of team building and internal operations logistics.” And hopping on that hamster wheel would be a huge waste of your talent and potential.
   

  

 You’re smart. You keep things clear and direct. And while you’ve worked in SaaS for many years, you don’t have a decade of outdated “leadership” learnings to unlearn. You’re ready to be the leader that smart employees like you have been waiting for. This job right here is your launchpad.
   

  

 You're a generative AI power user. You've used ChatGPT, Claude, Bard, or a similar tool to automate previously manual workflows (note: this role does not require a software development background).
   

  

 You should already be well on your way to building a strong personal brand. We believe in the importance of a personal brand, and we’ll help you develop yours. You should understand the benefits and impact of a personal brand, the long-tail nature of content, and the effort it takes.
   

  

 You have experience with quickly moving products, particularly in leadership roles during the launch of epic new features. If you’ve been part of teams going from Seed through Series A/B rounds, that’s a huge plus. You’ve got proven ability to get customers excited about new product features and have used metrics like net dollar retention and win-back rates (and others) to measure the impact of new product features.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Implementing AI-driven Productivity Improvements: Utilizing generative AI tools to streamline and automate various workflows across the company.
* Customer Engagement and Feedback: Interacting with customers to gather insights and feedback, and using this information to enhance product offerings.
* Develop a Personal Monopoly: Publishing podcast episodes and blog posts and building a social media following to evangelize your portfolio's AI-driven products.


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Busywork that drains your creativity.
* Day-in, day-out team management or internal operations that distract from your vision.
* Tinker with the business model to figure out what works. (Remember, we’re giving you the playbook.)


**Basic Requirements**
**Managing Director key responsibilities**
* At least 8 years of work experience in the enterprise software industry
* Leadership experience in marketing, sales, business development, partnerships, professional services, or another hands-on customer-facing domain
* Experience using generative AI tools to achieve quantifiable productivity improvements
* Currently based in North America, South America, or Europe


**About Trilogy**
 Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $200 USD/hour, which equates to $400,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.


 Crossover Job Code: LJ-4649-SE-Stockhol-ManagingDirect.006

title: Expert inom cybersäkerhet
description:
Vill du arbeta i framkant och vara en del av säker utveckling inom svensk industri? Hotbilden växer i och med den digitala transformationens obegränsade möjligheter. Vi söker nu fler som är eller vill bli expert inom området, är det du? Läs vidare!
 



  





**Det här blir din roll** 




 I rollen som cyberexpert hos oss kommer du hjälpa våra kunder att säkra sina system för att effektivt och mer riskfritt kunna driva sin organisation framåt. Du kommer lösa tekniska problem kopplat till säkerheten hos våra kunder och antagligen vara inblandad i flera uppdrag/projekt samtidigt. Vi arbetar ofta tillsammans i team bestående av vassa kollegor.
 



 Det kan exempelvis handla om att:
 


* Stödja kunder inom IT/OT och informationssäkerhet, t.ex. i form av behovsanalys, kravställning, design och arkitektur.
* Göra GAP-analyser för att identifiera säkerhetsrisker och lösa dessa tekniska utmaningar.
* Felsöka och administrera IT/OT-system.
* Konfigurera servrar, virtuella miljöer, brandväggar och nätverk.



  





**Så här kommer du att briljera** 




 Vi är bäst när vi är schyssta. När vi är schyssta mot varandra så mår vi bättre, tänker bättre och presterar bättre. Vi tror att du, precis som vi, har ett genuint teknikintresse. Vill du fördjupa dig i de tekniska problemen, hitta alternativa lösningar och förstå konsekvenserna av vad man gör och inte gör? Som person är du innovativ, gillar att samarbeta tillsammans med andra för att dela kunskap och hitta alternativa lösningar.
 



 För att lyckas i rollen:
 


* Har du 5 års erfarenhet eller mer inom informationssäkerhet.
* Har du erfarenhet av att sätta upp olika säkerhetslösningar.
* Har du kunskap om olika säkerhetsstandarder som t.ex. NIS2, ISO27001 och vad man behöver göra rent tekniskt för att uppfylla kraven.
* Brinner du för samhällskritisk verksamhet inom industrin och bryggan mellan IT/OT.
* Har du goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska (tal och skrift).
* Har du även certifiering så som CISSP, CompTIA och CSNA är det meriterande.
* Har du bakgrund/kunskap inom automation är det också meriterande.



  





**Att vara en del av Team PV** 




 Vi är väldigt stolta över att vara ett certifierat Great Place To Work-företag, vilket placerar oss bland de bästa arbetsgivarna i Sverige. Att vi även är med på topplistan över Sveriges Bästa Arbetsplatser är ett kvitto på att vi tillsammans har lyckats, och fortsätter lyckas med att, skapa en fantastiskt fin kultur.
 



 Vi är inte som alla andra – vi är unika med vår djupa kompetens och branschkunskap i kombination med vår varma passion och vår gemenskap som värnar om varje individ. Vi är en arbetsplats som är mer än bara jobbet. Och nyckeln är vi som jobbar här. Vi har ett engagemang utöver det vanliga, och älskar att dela med oss av våra briljanta tankar. Vi går in i det vi tror på, och vi gör det helhjärtat. Vi har energin hos det lilla företaget kombinerat med lugnet bara ett bolag med vår långa erfarenhet kan känna. Vi vill utvecklas. Vill framåt. Tillsammans för en bättre morgondag, det är Team PV.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Om du tror att vi är rätt arbetsplats för dig och att du är rätt för oss, skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Urval sker löpande. Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
 



 Om du har frågor om denna tjänst, välkommen att kontakta Magnus Rosendahl på 076 142 05 61 eller magnus.rosendahl@plantvision.se.

title: Security Manager, Nordics
description:
International SOS is the world’s leading medical and security services company with over 12,000 employees working in 1,000 locations in 90 countries. Established 35 years ago, we have become the market leader in global telehealth services and digital health solutions for an extensive client base of Fortune 500 companies, NGO’s and governments around the world.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The Security Manager will also act as the security peer to our clients in this location. They will be responsible for building on existing relationships and / or creating new ones within the client ecosystem to become a key advisor and strengthen relationships.
   

  

 The Security Manager will also support in demonstrating the value, real-life use, and the ongoing development of our Digital portfolio, as it pertains to a security user. They will help to embed our Digital solutions within our clients and act as a technical counterpart in helping enhance the value of these services with support from the region’s Digital Solutions Advisor (DSA).
   

  

****Key responsibilities****
* Be the security subject matter expert and partner for the commercial team in Nordics. To work closely with the Business Development Managers (BDMs)/ Directors to identify New Business opportunities, nurture them and drive acquisition of new logos and to work closely with the Key Account Managers (KAMs)/Directors to increase client stickiness and identify further opportunities for growth with that client (through consulting or other services)
* Support BDMs and KAMs to retain and strengthen our current partnership with clients, including actively participating in the development of the account plans to drive account growth
* Act as a subject matter expert on security for Workforce Resilience programs and consulting solutions; attend meetings with clients and prospects to scope solutions and drive positive client engagement from the outset
* Act as a subject matter expert on our Digital solutions helping our security audience to leverage value and help to drive utilisation in the region, in collaboration with our DSAs.
* Identify Security Consulting and Managed Services opportunities in collaboration with the regional Consulting Practice and Nordics Commercial team


**About You**
* Experience in security: corporate, consulting, military, police, intelligence, NGO, disaster management or relevant field of academia
* Crisis Management, Travel Risk Management, Intelligence, Security Risk Management
* Digital solutions experience
* Client management experience
* Business development related experience advantageous
* Extensive international experience
* Fluent in spoken and written in a Scandinavian language (e.g. Swedish / Danish / Finnish / Norwegian)


**Benefits**
* Competitive salary and incentive scheme
* Warm, supportive, and open company culture
* An opportunity to thrive in a global environment
* Hybrid working
* Birthday holiday and option to purchase additional annual leave
* Comprehensive Benefits Package


 #Europe #AG-1 AG1
   

  

 International SOS Facts & Figures 2022 (internationalsos-facts-figures.com)
   

  

 At International SOS, we offer a great working environment, thanks to our commitment to flexible working, diversity, and development. We encourage every person to be their personal best by creating an environment of inclusion, equality and support.
   

  

 International SOS has been recognised as a Top Employer in the UK by the Top Employer’s Institute (TEI) for 2024.

title: Sr. Account Executive
description:
**Hiring Manager**
**Talent Acquisition Advisor:** 
 Raj Hindocha
   

  

**Job Code Level:** 
 SGP4
   

  

 Refer Your Friends!
   

  

**OPENTEXT**
 OpenText is a global leader in information management, where innovation, creativity, and collaboration are the key components of our corporate culture. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to partner with the most highly regarded companies in the world, tackle complex issues, and contribute to projects that shape the future of digital transformation.
   

  

 OpenText Devops Cloud includes our Application Delivery and Management (ADM) portfolio which is a comprehensive suite of solutions and services designed to manage and operate the entire application development lifecycle. It empowers organizations to accelerate time-to-market, reduce costs, and enhance customer experience. The solutions cover project & requirements management, application lifecycle management, quality assurance, test automation and performance testing. With the latest ValueEdge solution OpenText ADM integrates these capabilities into a unified value stream management platform.
   

  

 By leveraging OpenText ADM, organizations can optimize resource allocation, improve collaboration among cross-functional teams, and effectively plan, build, test, and deploy software, enabling them to stay competitive in today's fast-paced and evolving digital landscape.
   

  

**YOUR IMPACT**
 As a Sr Account Executive for our DevOps Cloud portfolio, you will be responsible for leading pursuits in focused territories. You will be driving campaigns to build the pipeline, use specialized knowledge and skills to prospect, qualify, negotiate and close opportunities. For this opportunity, you will be responsible for a defined set of customers in Germany.
   

  

**What The Role Offers**
* Direct (software) sales experience
* Experience in selling Application delivery management (ADM), DevOps, Hybrid IT solutions is a bonus
* Works closely with the extended sales team with PreSales, Professional Services and Customer Success Management in building an effective Opportunity and Close plans


**What You Need To Succeed**
* Native or equivalent business fluency Swedish speaking and be able to express yourself well verbally and written in English
* Considered to master in knowledge of products, solution or service offerings as well as competitor's offerings to be able to sell large, complex solutions
* Demonstrates leadership and initiative in successfully driving specialty sales in accounts - prospecting, negotiating and closing deals.
* In-depth knowledge of client's business, organizational structure, business processes and financial structure
* Invest time working with and leveraging external partners to deliver or influence the sale. Use managent (up to C-level) engagement skills to offer value-add solutions to the client
* Utilizes CRM (SalesForce) system as an expert and accurately forecasts business


**One last thing**
 If you're ready to lead the charge in transforming IT operations and driving digital innovation, this role is for you. As a Senior Account Executive at OpenText, you'll leverage your expertise to help customers navigate the complexities of cloud-based IT operations and achieve their business goals. You'll work with top-tier clients in Sweden, using your deep knowledge of IT service management and sales acumen to close deals and build lasting relationships. Join us to be a key player in delivering AI-driven IT solutions that redefine value delivery in the digital age.
   

  

 OpenText's efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws.
   

  

 If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or recruiting process, please contact us at accommodations@opentext.com. Our proactive approach fosters collaboration, innovation, and personal growth, enriching OpenText's vibrant workplace.
   

  

 Micro Focus’ (now OpenText) efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or recruiting process, please contact us at hr@opentext.com.

title: Quality and Compliance Consultant
description:
**About Epista** 




 Epista Life Science is consistently expanding, and we are seeking experienced industry professionals to join our Swedish team. As a consultancy, we are dedicated to continuously improving compliance and business. Since 2009, we have expanded with dedicated and enthusiastic team members in several countries, and we have big ambitions for the future.
 



 Our team is our greatest strength – and we want you to be a part of it.
 



  





**About the Job** 




 We are looking for experienced consultants or Life Science industry professionals with experience in Quality, Regulatory, IT, R&D, project management, or similar, to join our Swedish team in Stockholm area. If you have worked in the Life Sciences, there might be a place for your skills and knowledge
 *here. As an Epista consultant, you will experience a variety of diverse assignments and master many different competencies, including technical skills and regulatory knowledge.* 




  





 Depending on your expertise and interests, you may work with:
 


* Compliance questions
* Validation activities
* Audit execution
* GMP Processes
* QMS Development and Optimization
* Project management



  





 The Epista team has extensive experience in various Life Science fields, in addition to technical expertise and project management. You'll be part of a team that increases the contribution of Life Science to society by turning compliance obstacles into business opportunities.
 



  





**Your Qualifications** 




 It´s about who you are - Important for us is not only the required skillset, but also that you’re a good cultural fit for the Epista Team. You are trustworthy, can work independently, have a high degree of situational awareness, and a flair for communicating with a variety of personalities. This is important because it ensures your image as a credible partner for Epista’s clients.
 



  





 In addition, you have:
 


* **At least 5 years of experience** 
 in any of the following Life Science areas: Compliance, QMS, QA/QC, QP, validation, auditing, or similar in a regulated industry
* A driven, structured, flexible, and ambitious mindset with a high focus on customer’s needs
* A desire to continuously improve your clients, your colleagues, your company, and yourself
* You speak and write
 **Swedish at a professional level,** 
 and you have excellent written and spoken English skills
* Possibility for occasional travel as some of our customers are located at different locations



  





***For this position we will only be considering candidates residing in Sweden, as well as being eligible to work***
***in Sweden.***




  





**On a typical day you might ...** 




 As an Epista consultant, you’ll be working at the intersection of compliance and business as a part of our highly skilled and dedicated team.
 



 You’ll be involved in a wide variety of projects and assignments and always in connection with various business areas. And the best part? You probably already have the skills and have done many of the tasks in your previous roles in the industry. But now, your time will be spent with our clients – international pharma and medical technology companies.
 



  





 Your daily activities might include:
 


* *Collaborating with colleagues at your clients and internally at Epista*
* *Developing, reviewing, and updating documentation*
* *Understanding and applying the customer needs*
* *Problem solving. Help clients solve specific problems or challenges they are facing, by applying your expertise and advice.*
* *Drive processes and projects*
* *Holding and facilitating training sessions*



  





**Why work at Epista** 




**What you’ll love about us** 
 is that Epista is a team of pioneers. As a part of the team, you’ll have the chance to experience the entrepreneurial atmosphere of our rapidly growing company.
 



  





 On our team you can profit from the following benefits:
 


* ***Atmosphere***
*: Great company culture*
* ***Learning***
*: Individual onboardings & trainings*
* ***Flexibility***
*: Hybrid working*
* ***Future***
*: Development & growing opportunities*
* ***Additional***
*: Social events & gatherings*



  





 Furthermore, our unique team spirit makes a positive impact – on our clients and the Life Science industry. Here, you’re never alone. We all work together for everyone’s success. And each individual is strengthened by the knowledge of the group.
 



  





 We’re proud to be Epista, for good reason. If you’re the cream of the crop, are you ready to join us?

title: Manager/Senior Manager PCAOB IT Audit to Capital Markets
description:
*Are you an experienced professional with 5 + years of direct PCAOB IT audit experience? Are you passionate about advancing your career in IT auditing and eager to engage with emerging audit and AI technologies? KPMG is seeking motivated individuals with a background in PCAOB auditing to join our Capital Markets team. Don’t miss the opportunity to be part of an international environment, a highly motivated team, and an ability to continue a career working with some of the most interested companies in the market!*
**About Us**
 Capital Markets is part of KPMG Deal Advisory which consists of four departments: Capital Markets, Transaction Services, Deal Strategy and Corporate Finance. As a team, Capital Markets takes on a wide range of assignments within our four service lines: IPO & ESG readiness, Deal Accounting, US Capital Markets, and Internal Controls. The Capital Markets IT Internal Controls team is a cross-functional team specializing in U.S. SOX IT Audit, Artificial Intelligence, and Automation technologies.
   

  

**Your role**
 As a manager or above in the Capital Markets IT Internal Controls team, you will:
   

  

* Lead and execute PCAOB IT audit engagements in the U.S., Sweden, and Europe, and ensure high-quality audit execution.
* Apply and maintain a strong foundational knowledge of PCAOB IT auditing methodologies and principles.
* Implement KPMG’s Audit Methodology and prepare clear and effective audit documentation.
* Interact professionally with clients and engagement teams and convey gathered information accurately.
* Identify and communicate potential issues and opportunities for audit efficiencies and process improvement to Senior Associates, Managers, and Partners.
* Travel frequently to various locations, including the U.S., Finland, Poland, the UK, and within Sweden.


 We believe that you demonstrate high energy and are eager to take on new challenges. You exhibit strong self-leadership and can manage internal and external client relationships effectively. Furthermore, you possess excellent organizational skills and can make strong decisions and take initiatives. You work under pressure and maintain commitment to delivering under tight deadlines, and you are diplomatic, pragmatic, and have excellent communication skills.
   

  

 To be successful in this position, you must have:
   

  

* A deep interest in accounting and a willingness to further develop within the field.
* Extensive experience in PCAOB IT auditing (5+ years), AI, or other relevant technologies.
* Working towards completing an accredited qualification (e.g., U.S CPA, CISA).
* A university degree in Finance, Economics, Information Security, Engineering or a related field.
* Excellent English language skills; proficiency in Swedish is a huge advantage.


**What do we offer?**
 If you’re looking for a firm with a strong team connection where you can be your whole self, have an impact, advance your skills, deepen your experiences, and have the flexibility and access to constantly find new areas of inspiration and expand your capabilities, then consider a career at KPMG Capital Markets.
   

  

 At KPMG, you will be part of a corporate culture that values each individual.
   

  

 We offer:
   

  

* Great development opportunities within a diverse environment.
* Challenging and socially important client engagements.
* A varied and responsible role with high-paced, stimulating social interactions.
* A comprehensive internal training and development program to advance your areas of interest.


 Don’t miss this opportunity to grow your career with KPMG, working on cutting-edge projects and developing your expertise in auditing and technology.
   

  

**Want to make a difference with us?**
 Then you are warmly welcome to apply! We select candidates and recruit on an ongoing basis and are happy to receive your application, which consists of your CV, a short cover letter, accreditations and grade copies from university/college as soon as possible, however no later than 1 September 2024. If you have any questions about the position, please don’t hesitate to contact Director Paige Moore (paige.moore@kpmg.se) or Manager Nate Mallett (nate.mallett@kpmg.se), who are both part of the Capital Markets-team. For any questions related to the recruitment process please contact Head of Talent Acquisition, Eva Bergquist (eva.bergquist@kpmg.se).
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Community Manager
description:
Our customers come to us for an inspiring place to work. As our Community Manager, you’ll help create it, motivating your team to provide a lively, thriving environment for all our members, visitors and guests. The job is similar to a Duty Manager in a hotel, and involves running the daily business at your location. You will also be responsible for customer retention and will build an active community to achieve this goal.
   

  

**A typical day at Spaces**
 Normally you start with a killer coffee at our Café Deli and have a chat with your community team and talk through the day.
   

  

 You usually sit at or near the reception so you know exactly what’s going on. In the morning you see all members come in and the first meeting room guests arrive. You guide them to their meeting room and help them starting up the system. You check if all necessary arrangements with our F&B partner have been made and make sure the system is updated.
   

  

 You have a meeting with a new member to get to know him better and know what his business is about. Maybe you can connect him with a member to do business together. You can introduce them tonight at the Wine Tasting or any of our business events you have planned for tonight.
   

  

 Tomorrow a new company is moving in the office upstairs. The reception team has already prepared a welcome kit, you will make sure the badges and keys are ready for the check-in tomorrow.
   

  

 Somebody walks in and would like to know more about a Spaces membership. Because your colleague from sales is already doing an office tour, you offer her a coffee and give a tour yourself while explaining all the ins and outs of Spaces. After you have covered for one of your team during her lunch break it’s time for you to enjoy a tasty, healthy lunch.
   

  

 In the afternoon you have all Community Managers and the Operations Director coming over for the monthly operations meeting. After the meeting you will prepare the weekly newsletter and then it’s time to get ready for the community wine tasting event tonight.
   

  

**Bring your personality to work**
**Role**
 We’re looking for a sociable, enthusiastic team player who loves multitasking and is extremely hands-on. You’ll need lots of experience in hospitality or events with some time spent in a supervisory role. You also need to be:
   

  

* Used to dealing with customers ideally in the lifestyle, media or design industries
* Someone who takes good care of their appearance
* Familiar with MS Office and other IT packages


**Last but not least**
**On Top Of a Competitive Salary Package We Offer**
* An inspiring work environment with room for your ideas
* Lots of social events you won’t want to miss
* Training and development

title: General Counsel to DigitalRoute
description:
DigitalRoute is an essential driver of the massive shift to subscription and consumption-based business models. Our customers are some of the world´s most iconic brands, and we help them process their data to find out how their services are used. Every time you make a phone call, book a flight, or watch a streaming service, there is a good chance our software is involved.
 



  





 We are now hiring our General Counsel. Take the opportunity and jump in to create a lasting impact with us!
 



  





**The Role** 




  





 As General Counsel you are responsible for leading DigitalRoutes legal and compliance function. As such, you will play a critical role in supporting the company´s operational and strategic initiatives by providing legal advice, ensuring compliance with applicable laws and regulations, and managing risks effectively.
 



  





 The role is broad, and you will provide legal advice to various departments within the company on a wide range of legal issues, including commercial contracts, corporate governance, intellectual property and compliance matters. Most of your working time will be dedicated to drafting, reviewing, and negotiating commercial contracts, primarily software and other IT-related agreements where you will be working closely with the commercial teams. Further, you will assist with corporate governance within the Group´s legal entities. You will also advise in various compliance matters such as GDPR and business ethics, and you are responsible for managing disputes and the cooperation with external legal advisors.
 



  





 You will report to the Group CEO and the place of work is Stockholm.
 



  





**Who are you?** 




  





 You have a Swedish LL.M. degree followed by at least ten years of experience from a law firm and/or as an in-house legal counsel. To succeed in this position experience from working in an international environment and being fluent in English is key. You have a solid legal background and broad experience from general commercial and corporate law. You have a strong interest in IT and tech and you have specific experience in drafting and negotiating software and other IT-related commercial agreements. You have significant exposure to working across multiple jurisdictions and cultures and you can juggle priorities effectively. To be successful in this role, you need to take initiative and manage activities on your own. Important qualifications are abilities to cooperate and communicate. We want you to be a person with integrity but also easy to work with. You are positive and committed, and you enjoy working in an international and entrepreneurial environment.
 



  





**What we offer you** 




  





 The role as General Counsel is crucial in facilitating business objectives while safeguarding the company´s interests and maintaining its standing in the industry. We offer you an exciting opportunity in an entrepreneurial fast-paced company operating in multiple territories.
 



  





**Application** 




  





 In this recruitment process, DigitalRoute is supported by Jurek Rekrytering & Bemanning. Interviews will be carried out as applications are received so please apply as soon as possible via www.jurek.se. Please note that we do not accept applications by mail. For any questions, please contact recruitment consultant Helena Woodcock by phone 0733 – 109585, or by email at helena.woodcock@jurek.se
 



  





 DigitalRoute wants to be part of an inclusive and diverse environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, or age. You will be part of a global and diverse company where our differences are our strengths.
 



  





***About us***




  





*DigitalRoute processes data about how customers use digital services. Our software is used by telecoms, streaming services, SaaS companies, and many others. Why does this data matter? Data about usage helps companies send accurate invoices, improve customer experiences, and control how much of a service is used. It even helps companies create entirely new services based on customer behavior. We help some of the world´s most iconic brands shift to subscription and usage-based services.* 




  





*Our company is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, but the workforce is globally spread in US, Malaysia, Bulgaria, APAC, EMEA*

title: Senior Project Manager – Information Security (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team:**
 The Security Department oversees security, governance, risk management, and compliance, and security operations for all Agoda. We are vigilant in ensuring there is no breach or vulnerability threatening our company or endangering our employees to keep Agoda safe and protected. Given that the security ecosystem is moving forward at tremendous speed, we like to be early adaptors of recent technology and products. This would be a great challenge for those who want to work with the best technology in a dynamic and advanced environment.
   

  

**The Opportunity:**
 Our IT Security team is looking for an experienced, implementation focused, self-motivated
 **Project Manager with IT Security background** 
 to drive key technology projects to completion. As a Project Manager, you will act as a point of liaison between the IT Security (Incident Response, Application Security & GRC) and global stakeholders (including but not limited to other Agoda Technology and Business teams but also External Auditors, Vendors, etc.).
   

  

 Familiarity with basic
 **concepts of Incident Response, Security Operations, Application Security, Risk Management, Compliance.**
 The role will require and independent pro-active thinker, strong stakeholder management, and natural team player.
   

  

**This position is open to both local and international candidates with relocation support available for eligible candidates to help ensure a smooth transition to working and living in Bangkok.**
**In this Role, you will get to:**
* Delivery of a diverse range of projects from supporting external/internal audits to responding to RFIs, coordinating between IT security teams and managing stakeholders
* Formulate, organize and monitor inter-connected projects
* Single point of contact for projects like: security or resiliency projects, audits, RFIs, external vendor for new initiatives
* Independently plan and manage select key projects to completion – these will typically be projects which are highly cross-functional or sensitive.
* Identifying and resolving complex problems/issues related to people, processes, and technology and strategy, both internally (organizational) and externally (client/engagement/project)
* Prepare project status reports and conduct meetings regularly on progress, risks, issues, and recommended solutions
* Decide on suitable strategies and objectives
* Develop and control deadlines, budgets and activities
* Apply change, risk and resource management


**What you’ll Need to Succeed:**
* Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as Business, Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, Information Systems Management, or equivalent professional experience
* 3 years of experience working in a project management role, or in a consulting company preferably in a security background.
* The ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and balance conflicting demands
* Comfortable analyzing operational and technical data, working under pressure and meeting deadlines
* Independent self-starter, problem-solving mindset, team player and ability to multi-task
* You have skills in facilitating workshops, summarize orally and in writing, build presentations in PowerPoint
* Strong communication, including presentation skills, able to convey complex concepts to a variety of audiences
* Strong project management skills
* The flexibility to make quick decisions as disasters change and develop


**It’s great if you have:**
* Security professional certificate (CISA, CRISC, PMP, ITIL)
* Experience leading global projects across different locations
* Individuals must have IT-related experience demonstrating each of the four competencies listed below:


- 

* Attention to Detail – Is thorough when performing work and conscientious about attending to detail
* Stakeholder management – Works with clients and leadership
* Oral Communication – Expresses information to individuals or groups effectively
* Problem Solving – Identifies problems; determines accuracy and relevance of information
* Relocation package is provided in case you prefer to relocate to Bangkok, Thailand. Our benefits are…
* Hybrid Working Model
* WFH Set Up Allowance
* 30 Days of Remote Working from anywhere globally every year
* Employee discount for accommodation globally
* Global team of 90+ nationalities
* 40+ offices and 25+ countries
* Annual CSR / Volunteer Time off
* Benevity Subscription for employee donations
* Volunteering opportunities globally
* Free Headspace subscription
* Free Odilo & Udemy subscriptions
* Access to Employee Assistance Program (third party for personal and workplace support)
* Enhanced Parental Leave
* Life, TPD & Accident Insurance
